summary:
Here is a clear and concise summary of the Security Council document:

The Security Council:

- Fully commits to the Peace Process in Colombia and supports the "General Agreement to End the Conflict and Building a Stable and Lasting Peace" between the Government of Colombia and the FARC-EP.

- Welcomes progress in negotiations, commitment to a swift end to the armed conflict, and confidence-building measures.

- Acknowledges the request by Colombia to participate in a tripartite mechanism to monitor and verify the ceasefire and laying down of arms.

- Recognizes the role of the UN as the international component of the mechanism for a limited period.

- Decides to establish a political mission (the Mission) for 12 months as the international component and coordinator of the tripartite mechanism.

- The Mission will monitor and verify the laying down of arms and be part of the tripartite mechanism.

- Requests the Secretary-General to initiate preparations, present detailed recommendations on the size, operational aspects, and mandate of the Mission within 30 days of the ceasefire agreement.

- Looks forward to contributions from Member States of CELAC to the Mission.

- Requests the Secretary-General to report to the Security Council every 90 days on the implementation of the Missionâ€™s mandate.

- Expresses willingness to consider extending the Mission upon joint request by Colombia and FARC-EP.
